value.title: Serverless containers with Azure Container Instances (ACI) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: In this episode, Azure CTO Mark Russinovich joins Scott Hanselman to show how you can use Azure Container Instances (ACI) to host a containerized application. Mark deploys an image processing container in three ways: as a standalone ACI container, as part of a Logic Apps workflow, and as the backend

value.title: Using Entity Framework Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jeremy Likness shows Scott Hanselman how to use Entity Framework (EF) Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB. EF Core is a lightweight, extensible, open source, and cross-platform version of the popular Entity Framework data access technology.  0:00 – Overview 1:43 – Using Entity Framework Core with
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FFgS_k_Muk8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: What are work or school, and Microsoft personal accounts? | One Dev Question: Jean-Marc Prieur
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Jean-Marc Prieur, a Principal Program Manager Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the difference between work and school accounts, and personal Microsoft accounts.   Get more information at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/

value.title: What is Azure Sentinel and why you should care | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn what Azure Sentinel is and how to use it. Azure Sentinel provides a threat detection and mitigation service that helps you to detect incident and threats when they happen and helps you to solve them as effectively as possible.    For more tips and
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dRpOR2GpL1s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: What types of managed identities exist? | One Dev Question: Arturo Lucatero
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Arturo Lucatero, a Senior Program Manager working on managed identities for Azure resources, explains the different types of managed identities in the Microsoft identity platform.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/role-based-access-control/rbac-and-directory-admin-roles

value.title: Capture feedback and monitoring data to continuously improve your software
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms
topItems.excerpt: Learn how surveys and application analytics create a feedback loop that helps you understand the voice of the customer.

topItems.title: Route system feedback to development teams
topItems.excerpt: Learn how continuous monitoring and dashboards give you insight into how customers use your software and where patterns of failure occur.

value.title: Implement knowledge mining with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Do you have information locked up in structured and unstructured data sources?  Using Azure Cognitive Search, you can extract key insights from this data, and enable applications to search and analyze them.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cognitive Search solution
topItems.excerpt: Unlock the hidden insights in your data with Azure Cognitive Search.

topItems.title: Create an enrichment pipeline with Azure Cognitive Search
topItems.excerpt: Use the power of artificial intelligence to enrich your data and find new insights.

topItems.title: Create a knowledge store with Azure Cognitive Search
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to persist the output from an Azure Cognitive Search enrichment pipeline for independent analysis or downstream processing.

value.title: Integrate Azure Synapse Analytics with Azure Data and AI services
value.excerpt: Integrate Azure Synapse Analytics with Azure Data and AI services

topItems.title: Build reports using Power BI within Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Build reports using Power BI within Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Integrate machine learning within Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Integrate machine learning within Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports data discovery, classification, and protection as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: Know your data, protect your data, and don't lose your data. These are the basic tenets of good information protection - data discovery, classification, and protection. This learning path provides an overview of the Microsoft data protection capabilities and how to use them to protect and govern data as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for the heads of federal civilian agencies to evaluate and classify agency data and provide to DHS and OMB a report of their evaluation, per Section 8 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **August 24, 2021**.

topItems.title: Intro to data classification and protection
topItems.excerpt: Learners should know and be able to describe data classification and data protection key concepts.

topItems.title: Configure security policies to manage data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up policies to classify, retain, and protect your cloud-based data.

value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports using multifactor authentication as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: Multifactor authentication helps secure your environment and resources by requiring that your users confirm their identity by using multiple authentication methods, like a phone call, text message, mobile app notification, or one-time password. You can use multifactor authentication both on-premises and in the cloud to add security for accessing Microsoft online services, remote access applications, and more. This learning path provides an overview of how to use multifactor authentication as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for agencies to adopt multifactor authentication and encryption at rest and in transit to the maximum extent (and report on progress every 60 days), per Section 3 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **November 8, 2021**.

topItems.title: Secure Azure Active Directory users with Multi-Factor Authentication
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use multi-factor authentication with Azure AD to harden your user accounts.

topItems.title: Implement and manage hybrid identity
topItems.excerpt: Implement and manage hybrid identity

value.title: Plan and implement data platform resources
value.excerpt: Deploy data platform resources in Azure for SQL Server and Open Source databases. Explore options for upgrade and migration.  Calculate resource requirements and create templates.

topItems.title: Deploy SQL Server in a virtual machine
topItems.excerpt: Configure virtual machine sizing, storage, and networking options to ensure adequate performance for your database workloads. Choose and configure appropriate high availability options. Investigate options for migrating existing workloads.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

topItems.title: Deploy MariaDB, MySQL, and PostgreSQL on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Compare Open Source Azure Database offerings with Azure SQL Server offerings. Configure an Open Source database and configure high availability and security options.

value.title: Process and Translate Speech with Azure Cognitive Speech Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement the Speech services found in Azure Cognitive Services by performing speech-to-text transcription, synthesize text input to speech, perform speech translation, and implement speaker recognition in your AI infused applications

topItems.title: Transcribe speech input to text
topItems.excerpt: Speech to text from the speech service, known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

topItems.title: Translate speech with the speech service
topItems.excerpt: Perform speech translation tasks with the speech service to translate spoken text to different languages.

value.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
value.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

value.title: Add basic conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
value.excerpt: Learn to identify valuable information in conversations with LUIS for interpreting user goals (intents) and distill valuable information from sentences (entities).

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in manufacturing
value.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, special factors, and use cases of an AI strategy in manufacturing that creates business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
value.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an enterprise AI strategy that creates real business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

value.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks
value.excerpt: Create an Azure Notebook and use three popular Python libraries to analyze climate data collected by NASA, then share it.

images.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks

value.excerpt: Analyze and optimize data warehouse storage in Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Analyze video
value.excerpt: Analyze video

value.title: Validate your deployments by using what-if and the ARM template test toolkit
value.excerpt: Leverage the ARM template test toolkit and apply it on your Azure Resource Manager templates to ensure the templates follow good practices before deployment. Apply the what-if command to see the impact of a deployment before it's applied.

value.title: Preview Azure deployment changes by using what-if
value.excerpt: Apply the what-if command to see the impact of a deployment before it's applied.

value.title: Architect full-stack applications and automate deployments with GitHub
value.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), deploy an end-to-end solution to solve the real-world scenario of catching the bus. You'll learn how to architect a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

value.title: Automate GitHub by using GitHub Script
value.excerpt: Learn to interact with the GitHub API from GitHub Actions by using GitHub Script.

value.title: Enable automatic updates in a web application using Azure Functions and SignalR Service
value.excerpt: Update a web app's notification mechanism from polling to push-based architecture with SignalR Service, Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions. Use Vue.js and JavaScript to use SignalR using Visual Studio Code.

value.title: See Azure in action
value.excerpt: The demos in this module provide an opportunity to see Azure in action.
